title: Windscreen Fixings

body.body: We have found that, in a small quantity of the models listed, there have been reports of cracks in the windscreen. Investigations have shown the cause of this to be fixings being tightened to the incorrect torque during assembly.
Dealers are required to make sure that they fit the fixings to the windscreens to the specified torque shown.
When adjusting the windscreen, always use the height adjustment handle.
If you do not follow this instruction, the windscreen may crack.
Damage of this nature is not a warrantable defect and all warranty claims for this issue will be rejected.
The torque wrench setting figures given in this document must be followed. The torque tools used must be of accurate calibration.
When tightening the fixings, always use a suitable torque wrench that can be set to the specified torque.
Incorrect torque on the windscreen fixings could lead to cracks developing in the windscreen.

Fit the two threaded spacers into the central runner.
